alert.note: Alert for West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:09PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CIBOLA AND EAST CENTRAL MCKINLEY COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 308 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McCartys, or 9 miles east of Grants, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grants, Cubero, Cebolletita, McCartys, San Fidel, San Mateo, Seama, Acomita, Bibo and Encinal. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 86 and 88, and between Mile Markers 95 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains
